hints.content:
**Perimeter** is the distance around the outside of a two-dimensional shape.

**Area** is the space inside of a two-dimensional shape. We can also think of area as the amount of space a shape covers.
Natalie is going to run **around** the park, so she wants to find the **perimeter**.

We can find the perimeter by adding all of the side lengths.  

[[☃ image 1]]

$\text{Perimeter} = \greenD{20}\text{ m} +\purpleC{20}\text{ m}+ \greenD{20}\text{ m}+\purpleC{20}\text{ m}$

options.alt: A square. The sides are labeled as follows: in green, 20 along the left side; in purple, 20 across the top side;  in green, 20 along the right side; and in purple, 20 across the bottom side. !

hints.content: Natalie ran $80\text{ m}$ around the park.

question.content:
Natalie runs around the outside of a square park in her city. Each side of the park measures $20$ meters. 

**How far did Natalie run around the park?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ meters}$
